<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Tattoo Artist](/Feats.aspx?ID=2962) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 118 <sup>2.0</sup>, [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 164 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Archetypes** [Runelord](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=103) (Level 2), [Runelord](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=303) (Level 2)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)

</column>

---

You can craft tattoos, including [magical tattoos](/Equipment.aspx?Category=46). When you select this feat, you gain the formulas for four common magical tattoos of 2nd level or lower. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) checks to [Craft](/Actions.aspx?ID=43) tattoos. If you're a master in Crafting, this bonus increases to +2 and you gain the formulas for four common magical tattoos of 7th level or lower.

<title level="2">Tattoo Artist leads to...</title>
[Legendary Tattoo Artist](/Feats.aspx?ID=4083)
name: Tattoo Artist
